review: After using Fire TV for just a couple of days with the trial Amazon Prime membership, I realized that I am actually not just buying the Fire TV but also the Prime membership (likely year by year in future). This is OK since It is pretty good to watch the Fire TV with the Prime membership; however, without it you just do not have much to watch. So here comes with a problem: Am I rating the Fire TV or the Prime membership? As a consumer, I would think to buy the Prime membership with a different coverage, or grade so to speak, and thus the price for the box will be inclusive of the Prime membership fee which includes the services of Fire TV. Would this be better serve everybody for what is really needed?
author: Amz Shopper
